Author: jansako#3330
Content:
Hi all, anyone knows what is the 'expected' number of blocks one can find with a z9 mini at this point? 
I mine on a pool (for now), it shows 'luckdays' for my miner around 0.7-0.8 or so on average. I read that as if I were to solo mine, I would get between 1-2 locks per day. 
The interesting part is that they pay out  8-9KMD/day, which is more like 2-3 blocks (looking at the avg block sizes). The 'pool luck' shows as average for that period too so it is not that the pool is finding more blocks than 'expected'.
One obvious conclusion is that the pool stats are 'skewed' to make you feel that you are getting paid more that if you were solo mine, but I am reluctant to jump to that.

Again, anyone solomining with a z9 mini, how many blocks do you get/day?

THX!

Author: jansako#3330
Content: I would appreciate a PM if you are reluctant to share publicly...

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: Extrapolating backwards from my increase, @jansako, I'd say 3-4 blocks per day "expected" per mini solo mining (influenced by luck and NN timings)

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: however, it should always be noted that scale does have some impact on find rate

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: Unless it's a 0 fee pool, over time you'll always make less mining in a pool; how well you can, personally, cope with variance is highly individual

Author: jansako#3330
Content: Thank you!

Author: jansako#3330
Content: Yeah, we had that discussion. Is the pool fee more or less than the electricity used by the PC running your local stratum/VPS fee ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: jansako#3330
Content: Are you sharing the costs by running other stratums etc

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: for the average person, the electricity used by the PC running your local stratum is less than the electricity used by the PC dealing with email and social media ðŸ˜‰
